instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message:
Hello there,

I have a machine with refurbished board in for repair with some weird red shit on it (see picture). Everything works except for pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys. 
I get 0V on 1, 2, 3 pins of keyboard connector (J4813).
<CHIP>U4850</CHIP> is also 0. 
<CHIP>U4801</CHIP> VDD is high. Should I replace it?

THanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message: Non working power button is unusual in combination with the common Shift/control/option problem. Is the keyboard known good? Is there 3V42 on pin 4 of the connector. Do pins 1 2 3 go high when the corresponding key is pressed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message:
So I gave it an ultrasonic bath and power button is back on, which is a victory already.
However, the shift/control/option is still not working. pin 4 is 3.42V. pins 1,2,3 are 0V even when pressing the keys.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message: That is either a bad keyboard or a bad connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message:
No Title

Could that be a problem?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message: Uhm, trace to pin 4 seems very fucked

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pwr, shift, ctr, opt keys dont work
threads.message:
No Title

Yep. Put the wire through the hole 4 and its working like a charm. Thanks Duke.
